basics.name: James Petty, M.S.
basics.label: Director of IT at TextRequest | Microsoft MVP | Author | CEO at The DevOps Collective INC.
basics.summary:
I serve as the CEO and Executive Director for the DevOps Collective INC (and PowerShell.org) a 501(c)3 nonprofit. My primary duties are to plan the PowerShell + DevOps global summit held each April and the DevOps + Automation summit held in October. I am responsible for overseeing a 1.1-Million-dollar budget and help coordinate or 20+ volunteers that help run the organization.

I am also an IT professional living in Chattanooga with many areas of interested including Automation, PowerShell, and Windows server administration. I am an Eagle Scout (2006) and a Vigil Honor member of the Order of the Arrow. 

I am also a contributing Author to the PowerShell Conference book Volume I. I am the co-founder of the Chattanooga PowerShell user group and the Co-Chair for PowerShell on the River, a 2 day PowerShell conference hosted each August (since 2018),

work.name: Text Request
work.summary: My role encompassed many responsibilities, including laptop procurement, user role-based provisioning, and de-provisioning. I also ensured robust endpoint security measures across Text Request. I handled the configuration of various SaaS software applications, which involved procurement, license management, and setting default security parameters. My duties extended to managing Identity and Access Management (IAM) processes throughout Text Request. I navigated various IAM solutions, such as Azure AD and Google Business, alongside one-off logins that do not allow SSO. To optimize efficiency, I spearheaded efforts to consolidate and streamline these solutions, favoring Azure AD or a combination of Azure AD and Google when necessary. Furthermore, I was pivotal in constructing monitoring and alert dashboards for proactive IT oversight. I worked closely with department heads to identify existing processes, leveraging IT solutions to simplify operations and enhance productivity, saving valuable time company-wide. I maintain our SOC2 Type 2 compliance and work directly with our auditors to ensure a successful audit.

work.name: Chattanooga State Community College
work.summary:
o	Utilize variety of technologies and instructional methodologies to keep courses fresh and engaging.
o	Work with individual students to improve understanding and course grades.
o	Help students develop talent through range of exercises, readings, and discussions.

work.name: The DevOps Collective INC.
work.summary: Serve as a volunteer member of the board of directors for the DevOps Collective CFO for DevOps Collective, Inc., a 501(c)(3) nonprofit working in the technology education space, as the Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. Help manage a $600k+ annual budget that includes scholarship programs and a 400-attendee annual community event. The nonprofit is focused on PowerShell, automation, and DevOps, and also runs numerous free online resources including PowerShell.org.

work.name: 714 Consulting
work.summary: Providing IT training and consulting services. Specializing in Windows Automation, PowerShell, Office 365, and Azure.

work.name: Tennessee Valley Authority
work.summary:
Working in a large enterprise helping to support over 2200 servers running the Windows Server operating system from 2003 -2016.
Responsible for patch compliance and baseline compliance on all Windows servers. Using System Center Configuration Manger (current branch).
Lead for the enterprise Print Management system. I designed and implemented a new architecture resulting in significant reduction in downtime due to human error and gained a major performance boost.
Technical lead for the evaluation and implementation of the Windows Server 2016 operating system. Testing new capabilities and working with a cross team of administrators we were able to roll out the operating system enterprise wide with in 18 months of the OS becoming Generally Available by Microsoft. 
Technical lead for the implementation of Just Enough  Administration for use by tier 2 helpdesk technicians on 1500+ servers.

work.name: Tennessee Technological University
work.summary: Helped students resolve their issues when connecting to the Residential Network at TTU by phone or email.

awards.title: Vigil Honor
awards.summary:
The Vigil Honor is the highest honor that the Order of the Arrow can bestow upon its members for service to lodge, council, and Scouting. Membership cannot be won by a person's conscious endeavors.

The Vigil Honor is a high mark of distinction and recognition reserved for those Arrowmen who, by reason of exceptional service, personal effort, and unselfish interest, have made distinguished contributions beyond the immediate responsibilities of their position of office to one or more of the following:

    Lodge
    Order of the Arrow
    Scouting community
    Scout Camp

awards.title: Eagle Scout
awards.summary: Eagle Scout is the highest achievement or rank attainable in the Boy Scouting program of the Boy Scouts of America (BSA). The designation "Eagle Scout" was founded over one hundred years ago. Only four percent of Boy Scouts are granted this rank after a lengthy review process.[2] The requirements necessary to achieve this rank take years to fulfill. Since its founding, the Eagle Scout rank has been earned by almost 2.5 million young men
